arts.ttl: Manuel Akanji admits he was trying to 'protect' Man City's £33m new boy Abdukodir Khusanov during nightmare start to debut against Chelsea
arts.sum: AADAM PATEL: Khusanov's weak header back to Ederson led to Chelsea taking the lead in the third minute before he was booked in the fourth minute.

arts.ttl: Manuel Akanji rallies round Abdukodir Khusanov after tough Man City debut
arts.sum: Khusanov was plunged straight in at the deep end with his first start in Saturday’s crucial Premier League clash with Chelsea.

arts.ttl: Debut errors ‘best lesson’ for new City recruit Khusanov, insists Guardiola
arts.athr: Jamie Jackson at the Etihad Stadium
arts.sum: Signing gave away Chelsea’s opening goal in shaky start Enzo Maresca defends Robert Sánchez after mistake Pep Guardiola defended Abdukodir Khusanov after Manchester City’s new £33.8m defender endured a torrid start to his debut in Saturday’s win over Chelsea, the manager saying this “is the best lesson you can take”. The 20-year-old’s weak header back to Ederson led to Noni Madueke’s third minute opener, and he was booked soon after for fouling Cole Palmer. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola's reaction to Abdukodir Khusanov spotted after nightmare Man City debut
arts.sum: Abdukodir Khusanov was handed his Manchester City debut by Pep Guardiola, but he endured a disastrous evening and was lucky his side bounced back to beat Chelsea 3-1
